newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia c/account deficit narrows in Dec.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia c/account deficit narrows in Dec.

text.p: Australia's seasonally-adjusted current account deficit narrowed to A$1.408 billion in December from November's deficit of A$1.893 billion (revised from A$1.923 billion), the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
This compares with a seasonally adjusted deficit of A$1.783 billion in December 1995.
The unadjusted December deficit was A$876 million against A$1.777 billion in November, compared with a deficit of A$743 million in December 1995.
Economists had on average forecast a seasonally adjusted December current account deficit of about A$1.78 billion.
The Bureau said exports rose 8.0 percent in December, seasonally adjusted, with rural exports rising seven percent and non-rural exports rising eight percent.
It said revisions have reduced the current account deficit for the first five months of the 1996/97 financial year ending June 30 by A$249 million.
